intro: Helicteres ovata subsp. hybantoides, commonly known as the hybantoides helicteres, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its hairy stems and ovate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
